page.title: 19Transport
page.content: Without personal transport one is virtually isolated.One bus per day travels west,one bus per day travels east.These services are supplemented by a market day (Wednesday)service.In car owning families,it is often the husband who travels to work in it leaving the wife without transport for the greater part of the week.Government policy is presently aimed towards greater privatisation of services and a reduction of subsidy to operators in the hope that this will create a more needs orientated service.It seems a far cry from the days when there were at least three trains per day each way to say nothing of a regular,reasonably priced rural bus service.It would be pleasant to see a social subsidy paid to those in rural areas to combat high fuel prices which penalise rural living.
